summary: the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities , according to a report in nation 's restaurant news . but mexican food fans should know that the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge - with the delivery fees for postmates beginning at $ 5 and up , depending on distance and demand . the app hires independent contractors who drive their own cars in a similar model to uber taxis .

aspect: - Chipotle will partner with Postmates to offer delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities starting this month.
- Chipotle decided to tap into the $70 billion food delivery market after rejecting previous offers from third-party delivery services.
- The restaurant will add a 9% service charge for delivery fees through Postmates, with costs starting at $5.
- Chipotle has been successful in recent years and has attracted presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton as customers.
- Chipotle aims to cash in on the lucrative delivery market by offering burritos straight to customers' doors.
explain: Chipotle is partnering with Postmates to offer delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities starting this month.

The given aspect highlights that Chipotle has not welcomed third-party delivery services up until now despite the $70 billion food delivery market. These include companies such as UberEATS and DoorDash. However, Postmates was the first to be accepted by Chipotle and will be working with them to deliver food to customers in 67 cities. The service will begin from January 21, 2021, and the company plans to add a 9% service charge to the delivery fee, which will vary depending on distance and demand. Postmates delivery services will be offered through the restaurant's online and mobile orders.

The aspect states that the restaurant plans to add a 9% service charge for delivery fees through Postmates. This means that customers who order through the online and mobile platform will be required to pay an additional 9% of their order total, in addition to the delivery fees, which can range from $5 to more depending on distance and demand. The service charge is meant to compensate the restaurant for the cost of providing delivery services through Postmates.
The given aspect highlights that Chipotle, a fast-casual chain, has been successful in recent years and has attracted presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton as customers.
Chipotle is aiming to cash in on the delivery market by offering burritos straight to customers' doors through their partnership with Postmates.
